entry.title: The Best Resources for Medellin Travelers
entry.summary:
It’s been a minute since the world discovered the “chevere” that is Medellin. That means there’s a significant amount of info out there for you to learn about the city. Check out this list of the most useful English resources for travelers to Medellin. 

More
entry.content:
Medellin tourism is booming. It’s estimated that there are over 500,000 international travelers visiting Medellin with the number shooting up every year. 

To give an idea of the scale of the boom: in 2010 there were only 5 hostels catering to tourists. Now in 2019, that number has exploded to over 150, with new ones popping up what seems like every few weeks in the tourist hot spots of Laureles and Poblado.

And with all these international visitors have come a likewise boom in the amount of English-language info out there for travelers coming through. 

Take a look here at some of the best online resources for you to use when planning your visit to Medellin. 

The Top Medellin Online Resources for Travelers

  • Medellin Guru
  • Medellin.Travel
  • Medellin Living

Medellin Guru

Medellin Guru provides a mix of info for tourists just passing through, “digital nomad” types on longer term stays, and full-time expats. 

Its content covers topics that concern pretty much any foreigner in Medellin, ranging from accommodation to restaurants, things to do, and Spanish schools. And this being Colombia, there is also information about learning to dance salsa and pueblos near Medellin worth a visit.

And when it’s time to head out from Medellin to your next stop in Colombia, Medellin Guru has a ton of great resources comparing different cities in Medellin’s region of Antioquia in addition to guides to some other top spots around the country like La Guajira and Isla San Andres. 

If you’re looking to extend your stay in Medellin or even convert into full time expat, Medellin Guru has a ton of resources for things like buying property and the visa process. 

What might be most impressive about Medellin Guru, is it’s pretty much all done by one dude, Jeff Paschke—the Medellin Guru himself! Jeff produces and updates most of the content himself. 

Medellin Guru IRL 

And Medellin Guru even crosses into the real world with monthly events at 20Mission Cerveza, a craft brewery in the Manila area (and this author’s favorite beer in the city). You can check out the latest Medellin Guru events and news on its Facebook page.

Medellin.Travel

Medellin.Travel is aimed just for travelers to Medellin and has all its materials in both English and español. It features a ton of information about the different areas and sites around Medellin. 

Medellin.Travel features a rigorously updated events section. It includes cultural events around Medellin, with things like concerts, museum events, and special dinners. If you’re a traveler in Medellin and looking to get off the tourist loop and try something unique, the Medellin.Travel events section is a great resource for you to use.

Medellin.Travel also has a great guide to Comuna 13, the barrio that inspired Comun13.

One downside of Medellin.Travel is that it doesn’t have much in the way of editorial content providing people’s opinions and experiences. But if you’re just looking for ideas of where to go and then supplement it with some further research, Medellin.Travel is the site to visit. 

From the City of Medellin to You

Medellin.Travel is actually run by the city government here in Medellin. This means that the events on the site sway much more towards “wholesome.” So if you’re looking for some all night Poblado bar crawls, Medellin.Travel shouldn’t be your first spot. However, it’s an awesome resource when you want to get out of the tourist bubble (or maybe take it easy the day after the Poblado bar crawl) and into some real paisa culture, Medellin.Travel is a great resource.

Medellin Living

Medellin Living is an awesome resource that is, as the name implies, geared at those living in Medellin. This means that its content focuses much more on how foreigners in Medellin can turn the city into their home, rather than those just passing through.

Even if Medellin Living’s content hasn’t been written specifically for travelers, it can still be a great resource since it has a super broad collection of content created by a variety of authors going back to almost a decade. 

The best part of Medellin Living for travelers is their restaurant and bar reviews. The content on the site is very food and drink heavy, giving travelers lots of ideas about where to get their munch on when they get tired of the street empanadas on their visit to Medellin.

Medellin living also contains what is probably the most comprehensive information about dating in Medellin, which contains some useful advice to anyone trying to win the heart of a paisa during their stay in the city. And if that date goes real well, you might just have to turn transition from a Medellin traveler to a full time expat!
